# Development Environment

The project uses `git` for revision control and repository management.  The 
primary repository store is currently located on:

[University of Illinois, School of Engineering, GitLab](https://gitlab.engr.illinois.edu/wbc3/msfe-ie522-statistical-methods-summer-project)  ![GitLab Logo](https://about.gitlab.com/images/press/logo/svg/gitlab-logo-gray-rgb.svg){height=60px} 


## Git <img alt="Git logo" height="50px" style="vertical-align:middle" src="https://git-scm.com/images/logo@2x.png" />

You will need `git` installed to manage changes to the code repository.

[Getting Started - Installing Git](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Getting-Started-Installing-Git)

## R and python <img alt="R logo" height="50px" style="vertical-align:middle" src="https://cloud.r-project.org/Rlogo.svg" /> <img alt="python logo" height="50px" style="vertical-align:middle" src="https://www.python.org/static/img/python-logo.png" />

This project primarily uses R for experiments and analysis but also includes
some python tooling.  Ensure that you have recent versions of these environments
suitable for your host system (Win, Linux, MacOS, etc).

[Download and install R](https://cloud.r-project.org/)

[Download and install python](https://www.python.org/downloads/)

## Tooling to manage localized project development environment

[renv: Project Environments for R](https://blog.rstudio.com/2019/11/06/renv-project-environments-for-r/) 

[reticulate: R Interface to Python](https://rstudio.github.io/reticulate/)
